text:
Hi all,
has it happened to someone?
I am trying to copy a theme from local to remote, the message says everything ok but does not copy anything

"
hs upload --account=giozua_personale Theme_Evolution_Pro Theme_Evolution_Pro
Uploading files from "Theme_Evolution_Pro" to "Theme_Evolution_Pro" in the Design Manager of account 8105220
[SUCCESS] Uploading files to "Theme_Evolution_Pro" in the Design Manager is complete
"
Thanks
Giovanni
Hey Bradley - modules should be overwritten when copied into the child theme. Can you DM me a link to your portal so I can investigate a bit? Thanks!

Thanks for the feedback! Could you tell me a little bit about how you manage these brands from a domain perspective? For example, are they subdomains or different brand domains?

Zooming out, we are thinking a lot about the relationship between your theme (or child theme), your domain, and your brand (color, fonts, logo, etc.).
In my case, it’s different brand domains. i’ll DM you the URLs so you can see.
Ive had client with both use cases.
One client had multiple micro sites, which are all similar, and they were hoping to use child theme for them all. But the we found out you can only have 1 :upside_down_face:

The micro site use case is definitely one we have not thought about for child themes. Would you be able to send me links to a couple of them? In general I'm super curious about how are users are leveraging microsites for their business within HubSpot.

Hi everyone…Looking for an answer on the below…

1. Can a theme be used for an existing customer / account ? Meaning they have an account and a website built already, along with many different templates, landing pages etc. I am trying to shorten dev time and am wondering if I can use a theme for a new page design that has been requested?  Does it impact other pages? Thanks in advance and happy to be part of the community!

<@U01MEGKHG7L> did you get an answer to this? I think i have the same concern.  I have a client that has a live website and many different templates and want to be sure that adding a theme will not “break” anything?
